results.title: Sign Up for the Science Times Newsletter
results.abstract: Every week, we’ll bring you stories that capture the wonders of the human body, nature and the cosmos.

results.title: Climate Change’s Fingerprints Turn Up in Parched East Africa
results.abstract: Droughts like the one that has ravaged Ethiopia, Kenya and Somalia are now 100 times as likely as in the preindustrial era, a new study has found.

multimedia.caption: A water well near the town of Kelafo in Ethiopia, one of the nations hit hardest by the drought.
multimedia.copyright: Eduardo Soteras/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

multimedia.caption: A water well near the town of Kelafo in Ethiopia, one of the nations hit hardest by the drought.

multimedia.copyright: Eduardo Soteras/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

results.title: A Century-Old Vaccine Fails to Protect Against Covid
results.abstract: Early in the pandemic, scientists began testing an old TB vaccine against the coronavirus. But the trial enrolled fewer participants than expected as new Covid vaccines were introduced, and no discernible effect was found.

multimedia.caption: In the early days of the pandemic, when there were no effective treatments for Covid and a new vaccine seemed a distant fantasy, health care workers were enrolled in a trial and inoculated with an old TB vaccine.
multimedia.copyright: Chaideer Mahyuddin/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

multimedia.caption: In the early days of the pandemic, when there were no effective treatments for Covid and a new vaccine seemed a distant fantasy, health care workers were enrolled in a trial and inoculated with an old TB vaccine.

multimedia.caption: In the early days of the pandemic, when there were no effective treatments for Covid and a new vaccine seemed a distant fantasy, health care workers were enrolled in a trial and inoculated with an old TB vaccine.

results.title: New Rules for Power Plants Could Give Carbon Capture a Boost. Here’s How.
results.abstract: The technology has struggled to gain traction, but strict new emissions limits for gas and coal stations could encourage broader adoption.

results.title: Kaiser Permanente to Acquire Geisinger
results.abstract: The California health care organization will create a new nonprofit that aims to acquire a half-dozen additional community health systems.

results.title: She’s More Than the Creator of Peter Rabbit
results.abstract: An exhibition in Nashville of Beatrix Potter’s works explores her love of the world of science and the challenges facing women of the Victorian era.

results.title: Bears, Binoculars and Bucket-List Birds: A 15-Day Tour in Ecuador
results.abstract: A customized itinerary allowed a group of birders to observe hundreds of species across a range of elevations, all while staying at comfortable eco-lodges.
results.byline: By Dorothy Spears and Alexis Rockman

multimedia.caption: Birds spotted at the various lodges, including hoatzin (bottom left) harpy eagle (front and low-center), paradise tanager (above eagle), chestnut-fronted macaw, (flying off to the right), and gray-breasted mountain toucan (flying off to the left).

Birds spotted at the various lodges, including hoatzin (bottom left) harpy eagle (front and low-center), paradise tanager (above eagle), chestnut-fronted macaw, (flying off to the right), and gray-breasted mountain toucan (flying off to the left).

Birds spotted at the various lodges, including hoatzin (bottom left) harpy eagle (front and low-center), paradise tanager (above eagle), chestnut-fronted macaw, (flying off to the right), and gray-breasted mountain toucan (flying off to the left).

results.title: La COVID-19 podría aumentar el riesgo de diabetes de tipo 2, según investigadores
results.abstract: Un estudio reveló que los hombres y las personas que sufrieron la enfermedad de forma grave tenían más probabilidades de desarrollar la afección en el plazo de un año. Pero los datos no prueban que el coronavirus provoque diabetes.

multimedia.caption: Un paciente de covid en la Unidad de Cuidados Intensivos de un hospital en Surrey, Columbia Británica. Un nuevo estudio apunta a un mayor riesgo de diabetes entre los hombres y aquellos con una enfermedad grave.
multimedia.copyright: Jonathan Hayward/The Canadian Press, vìa Associated Press

results.title: F.D.A. Approves Drug for Rare Form of A.L.S.
results.abstract: The drug, which will be sold as Qalsody by the pharmaceutical company Biogen, targets a genetic cause of a devastating neurological illness.

multimedia.caption: The approval of Biogen’s A.L.S. drug reflects the F.D.A.’s push to be more flexible in approving treatments for people with devastating illnesses and few options.
multimedia.copyright: Cody O'Loughlin for The New York Times

results.title: Here Are the Places Most at Risk From Record-Shattering Heat
results.abstract: It’s the regions of the world that haven’t yet experienced an off-the-charts heat wave that we should worry about, a new scientific study argues.

multimedia.caption: The receding waters of the Jialing River in Chongqing, China, during a heat wave last August.

results.title: Dragonflies, Beetles, Cicadas — What’s Not to Love?
results.abstract: An entomologist at the American Museum of Natural History is helping choose the insects for a new permanent gallery. It’s a task she loves.

results.title: Can Africa Get Close to Vaccine Independence? Here’s What It Will Take.
results.abstract: Leaders on the continent have vowed that if there is another pandemic, they won’t be shut out of the vaccine market.

results.title: Many Young Voters Bitter Over Biden’s Support of Willow Oil Drilling
results.abstract: Despite his aggressive moves to try to slash greenhouse gas emissions, President Biden has angered young climate voters upset by a drilling project in Alaska.

multimedia.caption: A ConocoPhillips drilling site on the North Slope of Alaska. The Willow project, authorized by the Biden administration last month, allowed ConocoPhillips to expand its drilling operations in the area.
multimedia.copyright: Erin Schaff/The New York Times

multimedia.caption: A ConocoPhillips drilling site on the North Slope of Alaska. The Willow project, authorized by the Biden administration last month, allowed ConocoPhillips to expand its drilling operations in the area.

results.title: She Redefined Trauma. Then Trauma Redefined Her.
results.abstract: Dr. Judith Herman, who helped launch the field of trauma studies, has returned to publishing after a long, mysterious ordeal.

results.title: Northern Lights Are Seen in Places Where They Normally Aren’t
results.abstract: The aurora borealis shone over an unusually wide area of North America and Europe. It was driven by a “big blob of plasma” from the sun, a scientist said.
results.byline: By Livia Albeck-Ripka and Derrick Bryson Taylor

multimedia.caption: The northern lights appear above Big Creek State Park outside Polk City, Iowa, on Sunday.

results.title: Chinese Censorship Is Quietly Rewriting the Covid-19 Story
results.abstract: Under government pressure, Chinese scientists have retracted studies and withheld or deleted data. The censorship has stymied efforts to understand the virus.
results.byline: By Mara Hvistendahl and Benjamin Mueller
org_facet: Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention

multimedia.caption: The shuttered Huanan market in Wuhan in 2021. Scientists say China has kept a tight rein on data from the market, where the first large cluster of coronavirus cases was found.
multimedia.copyright: Gilles Sabrie for The New York Times

results.abstract: El avance de la inteligencia artificial ha reavivado el histórico debate filosófico de la relación entre la mente y el cuerpo.

results.title: E.P.A. to Propose First Controls on Greenhouse Gases From Power Plants
results.abstract: If the regulation is implemented, it will be the first time the federal government has limited carbon emissions from existing power plants, which generate 25 percent of U.S. greenhouse gases.
results.byline: By Coral Davenport and Lisa Friedman

multimedia.caption: If the proposed regulation is implemented, coal and gas-fired power plants, like the Plant Bowen power station in Georgia, would have to cut their carbon dioxide emissions by 2040
multimedia.copyright: Kendrick Brinson for The New York Times

results.title: Many States Are Trying to Restrict Gender Treatments for Adults, Too
results.abstract: Missouri has imposed sweeping rules to limit health care for trans adults. Other states have banned Medicaid coverage or introduced bills outlawing care for young adults.

multimedia.caption: Aro Royston works for a U.S. defense contractor in St. Louis and has taken testosterone for eight years. “I’ve worked on defense programs to protect my nation,“ he said. “And my nation can’t protect me?”
multimedia.copyright: Michael B. Thomas for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Aro Royston works for a U.S. defense contractor in St. Louis and has taken testosterone for eight years. “I’ve worked on defense programs to protect my nation,“ he said. “And my nation can’t protect me?”

results.title: They May Be Just Acquaintances. They’re Important to You Anyway.
results.abstract: The people at the dog park, the bank teller, the regular waiter — these casual relationships may be “weak ties,” but they’re also a key to well-being.

multimedia.caption: From left, Pattie Marsh, Lee Geanoules, Lam Gong and Victoria Tirondola at Brookdale Park in Bloomfield, N.J., first began chatting about their dogs last spring.
